info.title: Test API
info.description: The Management API is a secure REST API that provides read and write access to your Kontent.ai projects and subscriptions.

tags.name: Basics
tags.description:
Use the Management API v2 to manage the content, content model, and configuration of your project. Subscription admins on Enterprise plans with a [Subscription API key](#section/Authentication) can also use the Management API to manage users, roles, and projects under a subscription. The base URL for all requests to the Test API is `https://test.kontent.ai/`. All requests to the API must be made securely with HTTPS with [TLS 1.2](https://github.com/Kentico/delivery-sdk-net/wiki/Fixing-error:-Could-not-create-SSL-TLS-secure-channel "A note on TLS 1.1 deprecation") and [authenticated](#section/Authentication) with a valid API key. Requests to the API are [rate limited](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/ea35e9bf-711d-4f2f-9da7-af79c825d55f) and uncached. ```curl curl --request GET --url https://manage.kontent.ai/v2/projects//items --header 'Authorization: Bearer ' --header 'x-continuation: ' --header 'Content-type: application/json' ```
**Need content filtering?** If you need to filter content and deliver it to your apps, we recommend using the Delivery REST API or Delivery GraphQL API.

tags.name: SDKs
tags.description:
We offer the following SDKs to help you interact with the API. However, you don't need an SDK to use the API.

* [JavaScript/TypeScript SDK](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/552424ff-28ed-4668-86eb-55400da43d87)
* [.NET SDK](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/fc2b0841-46c3-4fb4-9aa5-ea771b6fb221)

tags.name: Errors
tags.description:
The API returns standard HTTP status codes to indicate the success or failure of a request. In general, status codes in the `2xx` range indicate a successful request, status codes in the `4xx` range indicate errors caused by an incorrect input (for example, providing incorrect API key), and status codes in the `5xx` range indicate an error on our side.

### HTTP status codes summary

| **Status code**                                       | **Description**                                                                                                                      |
| ----------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| `400` **Bad Request**                               | The request was not understood. Check your request for a missing required parameter or an invalid query parameter value.             |
| `401` **Unauthorized**                              | The provided API key is invalid or missing.                                                                                          |
| `403` **Forbidden**                                 | The provided API key is invalid for the requested project.                                                                           |
| `404` **Not Found**                                 | The requested resource doesn't exist. Try checking the resource name for typos.                                                      |
| `405` **Method Not Allowed**                        | The requested HTTP method is not supported for the specified resource.                                                               |
| `429` **Too Many Requests**                         | The rate limit for the API has been exceeded. Try your request again after a few seconds as specified in the `Retry-After` header. |
| `5xx` **Internal Error** or **Service Unavailable** | Something went wrong on our side. Try your request again after a few seconds and use a retry policy.                                 |

### Resolving errors

For troubleshooting failed requests, the API provides error messages defined in a consumable format to help you identify and fix the issue.

<SchemaDefinition schemaRef="#/components/schemas/error" showReadOnly={true} showWriteOnly={true} showExample={true}/> 

If you cannot identify and resolve an issue with your API call, you can contact us with the response status and the request ID you get in the error response.

tags.name: Identify objects with references
tags.description:
References identify objects within your project. For example, you can use references to specify content types, content items, languages, and more.

When specifying references to objects, the object can be identified by **one** of three properties:

1. Its internal ID, such as `18b43cc5-f4fd-0172-842b-3ae2c878cf6f`  
   * Generated by the system automatically.  
   * Unique per object type such as content item, content type, and other.  
   * Can be used to specify any object.
2. Its codename, such as `object_codename`  
   * Initially [generated](#tag/References/rules-for-codenames) from the object's display name.  
   * Unique per object type such as content item, content type, and other.  
   * Can be used to specify most objects.
3. Its external ID, such as `custom-object-identifier`  
   * Specified manually when creating the object through the Management API. The external ID cannot be changed later.  
   * Unique per object type within its parent object scope. For example, the uniqueness applies to elements within a content type, content types within a project, content items within a project, and so on. This also means you can have a content type and its element with the same external ID.  
   * Can be used to specify custom identifiers for user-created objects such as assets, content items, content types and more.

## Reference object

The API uses internal IDs for referencing objects. This means that the reference objects in the API responses will always use internal IDs.

<SchemaDefinition schemaRef="#/components/schemas/reference" showReadOnly={true} showWriteOnly={true} showExample={true}/>

tags.name: External ID usages
tags.description:
By using external IDs to reference other objects in your project, you can import your content in the order you prefer. For example, when importing multiple articles that contain images, you can reference these images with external IDs, such as `roaster` or `coffee-cup`, before uploading them. The referenced images will be visible in the UI only after you [add them as assets](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/8106fbb4-1e56-4fd7-a59e-335a3a8f970d) via the Management API. With this approach, you can choose whether you want to create content items first and then upload binary files for assets, or vice versa. This means you can use external IDs to reference objects that don't yet exist in the project and add the objects via the API later. References to non-existent objects will be stored and retrieved via the Management API as internal IDs. To check whether your project contains any references to not-yet-created objects, see how to [validate project content](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/6e744e24-3d5d-4479-9c6d-39895c7d2e06).
**Referencing objects that are not in your project yet** The Management API supports referencing of non-existent objects in the following elements: * ... See how to import linked content to learn more.
## Missing objects in the UI If you use external IDs to reference non-existent objects in your elements, the referenced objects won't be shown in the UI. This is because the system cannot find those objects. The referenced assets, content items, and taxonomy terms will be displayed after you create them with their specific external IDs via the Management API.

tags.name: TEST resources
tags.description:
Assets in Kontent.ai consist of a reference to a binary file and metadata describing the file. Each binary file can be referenced only by a single asset. Binary files that are not used by any assets will not be visible in the Kontent.ai UI.
**Adding assets is a 2-step process** 1. [Upload a binary file](#operation/upload-a-binary-file) – after uploading, you get a file reference to uploaded file. 2. [Create a new asset](#operation/add-an-asset) – use the file reference to link the new asset with the file.
## Asset object ## Asset element ## Content type snippet element The Content type snippet elements are expanded into the elements that they contain. You can recognize the expanded elements by their codenames, which use the following format: `__`. For example, when you [retrieve an item](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/419ae032-ad24-4990-89a7-2f13ba7c9beb) that uses a snippet element with 2 elements, the snippet itself will be structured as the 2 elements, without any encapsulation. ```json "seo_metatata__meta_keywords": { "type": "text", "name": "Meta keywords", "value": "donation, africa" }, "seo_metatata__meta_description": { "type": "text", "name": "Meta description", "value": "Regularly donate money." } ``` ## Custom element [Create your own custom element](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/70496a22-6c7a-4c15-ab88-b70b9f3d24f1) or discover existing ones in the [Custom element sample gallery](https://kentico.github.io/kontent-custom-element-samples/gallery/ "Custom element sample gallery"). ## Date and time element ## Linked items element ## Multiple choice element ## Number element ## Rich text element In addition to formatted text, the rich text element's `value` property can contain objects representing images, components, content items. Information about these objects is stored in separate properties: * `images` – stores metadata of assets in the text. * `links` – stores metadata about content items linked in the text. * `modular_content` – stores metadata of linked items and components in the text. ### Images (single object) The images in the rich text's `value` are represented by the `figure` and `img` HTML tags. ```html ``` ### Links (single object) The links in the rich text's `value` are represented by the `a` HTML tags. ```html link to a content item link to web URL mailto link link to asset ``` ### Modular content (components and items in rich text) The content items and components inserted in the rich text's `value` are represented by the `object` HTML element. For both content items and components, the `object` HTML element specifies these attributes: * `data-type` – Its value is `item` for both content items and components. This lets you use a single method to resolve your items and components. * `data-rel` – Its value is either `link` (for content items inserted into rich text) or `component` (for components inserted into rich text). Use the attribute to differentiate between components and items. * `data-codename` – Its value specifies the codename of the content item or component.
**Two distinct** `modular_content` **properties** In the `modular_content` object property of the Delivery API response, you can find the contents of the linked content items and content components. In the rich text element's [modular_content array property](#section/Rich-text-element/modular-content-components-and-items-in-rich-text), you can find the codenames of the inserted content items and content components. The codenames in the rich text's `modular_content` array are grouped and ordered. First comes a group of item codenames followed by a group of component codenames. The order of codenames in each group matches that in the UI.
```html ``` ## Subpages element This element works only with [Web Spotlight](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/fd0a51f1-703e-4eba-9882-5874d3ab61f3) enabled. ## Taxonomy element ## Text element ## URL slug element

post.description:
Use a file reference to link an existing [binary file](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/ce2c4b08-10e7-4497-b1ef-8ceebc606fe0) to a new asset. You can also [create assets by upserting](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/8106fbb4-1e56-4fd7-a59e-335a3a8f970d) (PUT `/assets/external-id/`).
Each binary file can be referenced only by a single asset.

put.description:
Move the specified language variant to the specified workflow step in the default workflow. * The workflow step of a published language variant cannot be changed. You need to [unpublish](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/1a7fbc3b-1d3f-4eaa-8da9-f8d6e44c91e6) or [create a new version](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/54caab49-6357-47ac-9895-59c84e07e250) first. * For [publishing](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/fc78b528-9249-4a6b-8bb3-0ab121696f2a) and [scheduling](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/807db2f1-e413-4697-9ae7-6d4f9ad32e58), use the dedicated [Publish endpoint](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/ac9d9466-c3b8-477c-98e5-acc8dd93e93b). * For [unpublishing and archiving](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/1754cacf-7aed-47b1-a9a6-f270293e14e8), use the dedicated [Unpublish endpoint](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/f64599e8-6179-4456-a77c-6716c2e3864b) to move the specified language variant to the "Archived" step. The Management API ignores the [workflow transition limitations](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/9a4df3f8-4568-4830-be6d-f864e6509475) present in the UI. This means you can change the workflow step of the language variant from any step to any other step excluding Published or Scheduled.
**Use a new endpoint** Starting April 2022, this endpoint has been deprecated in favor of the new endpoint that supports multiple workflows.
put.summary: Change the workflow step of a language variant

get.description:
Retrieve a list of content items from your project. By default, the API returns an unfiltered paginated list of content items ordered alphabetically by codename. The [response size](#section/Response-size) is limited to 2000 items. The `modular_content` object property will contain both components and linked items in the API response. See [Linked content and components](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/286dbb0e-f673-494f-abfd-3f39c7ec3446) for more details. If you need to export all content items from your project, we recommend using the [Enumerate content items](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/ac1819e7-aec6-4b26-a649-2a4efc377281) endpoint. You can change the order by specifying the `order` query parameter. You can customize pagination by specifying both the `skip` and `limit` query parameters. Note that the `limit` parameter affects only the `items` property, not `modular_content`.
**Get only the items you need** To retrieve specific content items, use the filtering parameters in your requests. For example, you can request items tagged with a taxonomy term, items of a specific type, or items modified in the past three days.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request GET \
  --url 'https://deliver.kontent.ai/<YOUR_PROJECT_ID>/items?system.type=article&limit=3' \
  --header 'content-type: application/json'

# Tip: Find more about Ruby SDKs at https://kontent.ai/learn/ruby
require 'delivery-sdk-ruby'

delivery_client = Kentico::Kontent::Delivery::DeliveryClient.new project_id: '<YOUR_PROJECT_ID>'
delivery_client.items('system.type'.eq('article'))
               .limit(3)
               .execute do |response|
                 items = response.items
               end

patch.description:
Modify content types, their elements, and the configuration of specific objects.

You can modify the specified content type and its contents in three ways based on your chosen operation type (in the `op` body parameter):

* `addInto` to add an element or content group to the content type or add an option to a multiple choice element.
* `remove` to delete a specific element or content group from the content type or delete a specific option from a multiple choice element.
* `replace` to change the value of a specific property of a specified object.

For any operation that does not affect the content type itself, you need to include a `{path_reference}` in the `path` body parameter for the object you want to modify. Path references can be by ID, codename, or external ID, but take a slightly different form from references to the content type:

* `id:5eb3d03e-c69d-4e93-b4cc-76f453271386`
* `codename:my_text_element`
* `external_id:text_from_external_database` – Any special characters such as slashes (`/`) need to be escaped, so the external ID `my/value` would need to be added to `path` as `external_id:my/value`.

put.description:
Change the workflow step of the specified language variant to "Published" or schedule publishing at the specified time.

* Equivalent to the UI operations of [publishing](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/fc78b528-9249-4a6b-8bb3-0ab121696f2a) and [scheduling](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/807db2f1-e413-4697-9ae7-6d4f9ad32e58) content.
* The Management API ignores the [workflow transition limitations](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/9a4df3f8-4568-4830-be6d-f864e6509475) present in the UI. You can publish or schedule a language variant in any workflow step.
* Scheduling a published language variant does nothing.
put.summary: Publish or schedule a language variant

x-codeSamples.source:

post.description:
Add a new file. The uploaded file will not be visible in the Kontent.ai UI unless you [add an asset](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/33e07eb5-fa13-4760-a42c-6674cdb3805f) that uses the file.
**Adding assets is a 2-step process** 1. [Upload a binary file](#operation/upload-a-binary-file) – after uploading, you get a file reference to uploaded file. 2. [Create a new asset](#operation/add-an-asset) – use the file reference to link the new asset with the file.
Maximum size limit for binary files is 100 MB.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request POST \
  --url https://manage.kontent.ai/v2/projects/<YOUR_PROJECT_ID>/files/which-brewing-fits-you-1080px.jpg \
  --data-binary "@which-brewing-fits-you-1080px.jpg" \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <YOUR_API_KEY>' \
  --header 'Content-type: image/jpeg' \
  --header 'Content-length: 125770'

x_request_charge_a9674e2.description:
Specifies the number of content items returned in the response. This number covers both the items that directly match the specified query and the linked items returned in the response's `modular_content` property.

If the `X-Request-Charge` value of your requests exceeds 1000, we recommend applying more specific [filters](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/b6cf1d73-471a-4f1e-b0a9-f0e041e2d905) and checking if a lower value for the [`depth` parameter](#tag/Linked-content-and-components/linked-content-depth) works for you. Fewer items returned per response means shorter response times and better performance for your app.

a5e8fb68_038a_0111_225b_201408613d14.title: value
a5e8fb68_038a_0111_225b_201408613d14.description:
The value of taxonomy elements is an array of [Reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) objects. Each reference represents a taxonomy term of a specific taxonomy group. Every taxonomy term can be referenced only once.

When retrieving taxonomy elements, the Management API will always reference taxonomy terms with their internal IDs. When updating taxonomy elements via the API, you can reference a taxonomy term by its internal ID, external ID, or codename.

a5f8e2d5_472f_01db_9a95_d95cd3088af4.title: is_required
a5f8e2d5_472f_01db_9a95_d95cd3088af4.description: Determines whether the element must be filled in.

a61b5778_6f2e_016f_0992_cfed849acc6f.title: image_height_limit
a61b5778_6f2e_016f_0992_cfed849acc6f.description: Specifies the height limitation for the asset.

a698aafe_0c99_01de_07cc_2255f74dac82.title: guidelines
a698aafe_0c99_01de_07cc_2255f74dac82.description: The element's guidelines, providing instructions on what to fill in.

a6be9b2b_718f_015a_fc50_f182e78f6884.title: modular_content
a6be9b2b_718f_015a_fc50_f182e78f6884.description:
A dictionary of [components and linked items](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/286dbb0e-f673-494f-abfd-3f39c7ec3446).

**Note**: The items and components are not in any particular order.

a885c49a_9eba_01a7_3fa1_64b546d86a3f.title: path
a885c49a_9eba_01a7_3fa1_64b546d86a3f.description:
A string identifying the property that should be replaced. The exact path depends on what you are trying to replace. If you need to add a property to an object, specify a `{path_reference}` for that object.

* To change the content type's name, set `path` to: `/name`.
* To change the content type's codename, set `path` to: `/codename`.
* To change the name of a content group, set `path` to: `/content_groups/{path_reference}/name`.
* To change a given property of an element, set `path` to: `/elements/{path_reference}/{property_name}`, where the available values for `{property_name}` will depend on the specific element you are referencing.
* To change a property of a multiple choice option, set `path` to: `/elements/{path_reference}/options/{path_reference}/{property_name}`, where the first `{path_reference}` is to the multiple choice element, the second `{path_reference}` is to the option you want to modify, and the `{property_name}` value will be either `name` or `codename`. See [multiple choice element structure](#section/Multiple-choice-element-in-type) for details.

For all elements (including multiple choice options), you can specify the properties to be modified based on the [element type](#tag/Elements-in-content-types). You cannot modify the `external_id`, `id`, or `type` of the elements. It is also not possible to replace individual values for an object (such as the value of a limitation object) – you need to replace the entire object at once. You also cannot replace the allowed blocks for rich text elements; you need to add or remove the blocks one by one.

a8b0965a_305a_011e_00c5_e5b66a61e2b0.title: codename
a8b0965a_305a_011e_00c5_e5b66a61e2b0.description: The element's codename. Unless specified, [initially generated](#tag/References/rules-for-codenames) from the element's `name`.

aa98028f_b89e_0153_659c_ba5bdbb18a8c.title: allowed_table_formatting
aa98028f_b89e_0153_659c_ba5bdbb18a8c.description:
Specifies which text formatting is allowed inside tables in your rich text element. To allow all formatting, leave the array empty. To allow only plaintext, use `["unstyled"]`.
The `unstyled` value must precede any other values in the list.

b0e9c145_50d0_01a3_2338_bacb97783714.title: regex
b0e9c145_50d0_01a3_2338_bacb97783714.description:
The regular expression used for validation.

Examples:

* Email address: `^(?:[a-z0-9!#$%&'*+/=?^_`{|}~-]+(?:.[a-z0-9!#$%&'*+/=?^_`{|}~-]+)*|"(?:[x01-x08x0bx0cx0e-x1fx21x23-x5bx5d-x7f]|[x01-x09x0bx0cx0e-x7f])*")@(?:(?:[a-z0-9](?:[a-z0-9-]*[a-z0-9])?.)+[a-z0-9](?:[a-z0-9-]*[a-z0-9])?|[(?:(?:25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?).){3}(?:25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?|[a-z0-9-]*[a-z0-9]:(?:[x01-x08x0bx0cx0e-x1fx21-x5ax53-x7f]|[x01-x09x0bx0cx0e-x7f])+)])$`
* US phone number: `^(+1[s.-]?)?(?d{3})?[s.-]?d{3}[s.-]?d{4}$`
* Web URL: `^(https?://(?:www.|(?!www)))?[a-z0-9]+([-.]{1}[a-z0-9]+).[a-z]{2,5}(:[0-9]{1,5})?(/S)?$`

Certain formats like JSON require the regex pattern to be in escaped form. See the [MDN regex guide](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Guide/Regular%5FExpressions) for details on regular expressions.

da34bfc2_84d6_01a9_cc2d_50f0562dc893.title: value
da34bfc2_84d6_01a9_cc2d_50f0562dc893.description:

**Matching order** The order of the codenames in the array matches the order of the content items in the UI. The content of these items can be found in the `modular_content` property (where the items are not ordered) of the API response when getting content items.

db88862b_a974_01a8_ff99_49e322faff52.title: folder
db88862b_a974_01a8_ff99_49e322faff52.description:

To return an asset to the top level outside any folders, use `"id" : "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000"`.

dc29b58e_29fd_0127_5700_7a2d4e1579ed.title: total_count
dc29b58e_29fd_0127_5700_7a2d4e1579ed.description:

The property is present only when [listing content items](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/4fafdf10-32c6-4020-a91a-cf1f835f8107) and using the `includeTotalCount` query parameter.

dea0777c_a81a_015a_bec5_0cba4a3c0b84.title: id

e48ff097_e46c_012a_8da7_09db37b91079.description: Determines whether the element must be filled in.

e8d14717_b3a3_017c_0a7b_972842725f2b.title: value
e8d14717_b3a3_017c_0a7b_972842725f2b.description:
The object to add. The value depends on the selected `path`:

1. To add a new element, use a [content element](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/97850d2c-d2ec-4750-870a-16bc98271523) object
2. To add a new content group, use a [content group](#section/Content-group-object) object.
3. To add an allowed content type to a rich text or linked items element, use a [reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) object that points to a specific content type.
4. To add an allowed element to a custom element, use a [reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) object that points to the specific element.
5. To add an option to a multiple choice element, use an [option](#section/Multiple-choice-type-element) object.
6. To add an allowed block, text block, or text formatting to a rich text element, use an [array of strings](#section/Rich-text-type-element) to specify its value.

e8e06660_9e51_0143_2fec_011d9061db86.title: maximum_file_size
e8e06660_9e51_0143_2fec_011d9061db86.description: Specifies the maximum file size in bytes.

e93151e4_1e77_01dd_8713_3b5cda3b7deb.title: references
e93151e4_1e77_01dd_8713_3b5cda3b7deb.description: A collection of [references](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) used for defining {~allowed_content_types~} in rich text and linked items elements and {~allowed_elements~} in custom elements.

ee1026a8_960a_01f6_3ae1_8e61e1ce03c0.description:

Non-localizable elements are available through early access program and may change in the future. Get familiar with [current limitations](/learn/tutorials/manage-kontent-ai/content-modeling/create-and-delete-content-types/#a-early-access-limitations-for-non-localizable-elements). Contact us and we'll activate non-localizable elements for you.

f8730cdc_4af3_01c4_ef3d_9abc5bb5e6d9.description: Specifies content types of items that are allowed to be used in text links as an array of [references](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e). n081e7e82_150e_016f_0c98_837c5458515b.title: path
n081e7e82_150e_016f_0c98_837c5458515b.description:
A string identifying the specific object or property that should be removed. The exact path depends on what you are trying to remove. In each case, a `{path_reference}` is needed for the given object.

To remove given objects:

* For an element, set {~path~} to: {~/elements/{path_reference}~}.
* For an allowed content type from a rich text or linked items element, set {~path~} to: {~/elements/{path_reference}/allowed_content_types/{path_reference}~}, where the first {path_reference} is to the rich text or linked items element and the second is to the allowed content type to be removed.
* For an allowed element from a custom element, set {~path~} to: {~/elements/{path_reference}/allowed_element/{path_reference}~}, where the first {path_reference} is to the custom element and the second is to the allowed element to be removed.
* For a multiple choice option, set {~path~} to: {~/elements/{path_reference}/options/{path_reference}~}, where the first {path_reference} is to the multiple choice element and the second is to the option to be removed.
* For a content group, set {~path~} to: {~/content_groups/{path_reference}~}. **Note**: This will also remove all elements contained within the content group.
* For a rich-text element limitation, set {~path~} to: {~/elements/{path_reference}/allowed_blocks/{block}~}, where {block} is the given type of limitation you want to remove.

n08ccd7ac_8dd2_0168_93c9_badd59b6f4d4.title: allowed_image_types
n08ccd7ac_8dd2_0168_93c9_badd59b6f4d4.description:
Specifies which image types are allowed.

* {~adjustable~} for [images that that support image transformation](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/12c3cb42-21d4-4263-9943-77f74418cb2f)

n299aa40d_79a2_01b8_c5ef_7887bd6d2c0a.title: modular_content
n299aa40d_79a2_01b8_c5ef_7887bd6d2c0a.description:
Contains codenames of the [components and content items](#section/Rich-text-element/modular-content-components-and-items-in-rich-text) (not their contents) inserted into the rich text element. To get the contents of the inserted components and items, see how to [retrieve linked content](#tag/Linked-content-and-components/retrieve-linked-content).
**Two distinct** `modular_content` **properties** In the `modular_content` object property of the Delivery API response, you can find the contents of the linked content items and content components. In the rich text element's [modular_content array property](#section/Rich-text-element/modular-content-components-and-items-in-rich-text), you can find the codenames of the inserted content items and content components. The codenames in the rich text's `modular_content` array are grouped and ordered. First comes a group of item codenames followed by a group of component codenames. The order of codenames in each group matches that in the UI.

n57708150_7045_012a_225a_c2fe7196fab8.title: path
n57708150_7045_012a_225a_c2fe7196fab8.description:
A string identifying where the new object or property should be added. The exact path depends on what you are trying to add and where. If you are trying to add a property to a given element, a `{path_reference}` is needed for that element.

1. To add a new element, set `path` to: `/elements`.
2. To add a new content group, set `path` to: `/content_groups`.
3. To add an allowed content type to a rich text or linked items element, set `path` to: `/elements/{path_reference}/allowed_content_types`.
4. To add an allowed element to a custom element, set `path` to: `/elements/{path_reference}/allowed_elements`.
5. To add a new multiple choice option, set `path` to: `/elements/{path_reference}/options`.
6. To add a block so it can be used in a rich text element, set `path` to: `/elements/{path_reference}/allowed_blocks`.

n58db91e3_c896_01b0_1663_4fe9ef76f9f8.title: allowed_content_types
n58db91e3_c896_01b0_1663_4fe9ef76f9f8.description: Specifies allowed file types as an array of [references](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) to the content types.

n59b8978d_8a7c_015e_fb32_8c87b6d5329f.title: display_timezone
n59b8978d_8a7c_015e_fb32_8c87b6d5329f.description:
[IANA time zone name](https://timezonedb.com/time-zones) used to display time offset of the scheduled publish date in the UI.

The time zone doesn't modify the schedule publish date specified in the `scheduled_to` property.

If omitted, the scheduled publish date will be displayed in a local time zone.

n5c08a3e2_4c79_01e1_9215_87c50f9917c1.title: before
n5c08a3e2_4c79_01e1_9215_87c50f9917c1.description:
An _optional_ [reference to the object](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) before which you want to add the new object. For example, to add an element or multiple choice option before an existing element or option named "Text", you can set `before` to `{codename: text}`.
The `before` and `after` properties are mutually exclusive.

n5d6da5ab_2eca_0120_c1cf_ac3c648e9db9.title: value

When adding a content type, you must identify the content group by specifying its codename, external ID, or both. In the content elements, you specify a reference to the content group using either the group's codename or external ID.

n81e1d9d7_0c93_01a3_7890_789e9afb8093.description: The asset's display name. The title can be specified when adding or upserting assets. Use this parameter to better identify and filter your assets in the UI. If not specified, the `title` property is `null`.

n8a79a2ad_2122_01b1_4587_f83ac23192fd.description:

Some of the properties are specific to images only: `width` and `height` represent the image's width and height dimensions and the `renditions` object contains details about [customized images](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/41122488-31c5-47ba-8444-05a3e87d10a0).

n98b52c50_940b_0144_05f4_1538b274e96d.description: Specifies a human-friendly message used in validation. Content creators will see the validation message if the value they provide doesn't match the regex pattern.

n99619c98_0e62_01f6_6987_408ae6ce89a4.description: The element's guidelines, providing instructions on what to fill in.

n9a3bcecd_0625_0185_434e_c7d83b6e5814.description: Specifies which blocks are allowed inside your rich text element. You can allow text, tables, images, and components and items. To allow all blocks, leave the array empty.

pagination.description: Information about the current page of results.

rich_text_image_object.title: Rich text image
rich_text_image_object.description: The name of the object represents an image id, such as {~14mio~}.

rich_text_link_object.title: Rich text link
rich_text_link_object.description: The name of the object represents a content item ID, such as {~f4b3fc05-e988-4dae-9ac1-a94aba566474~}.

untitled_content_item_4b71df4.title: rendition
untitled_content_item_4b71df4.description: The name of the object represents an image preset's codename. Currently, there's only one default preset that holds the [customized image](/tutorials/write-and-collaborate/create-content/work-with-media#a-customize-assets-for-a-better-fit).

validation_regex.title: ValidationRegex
validation_regex.description: Specifies a regular expression pattern used to validate the element's value.

content_length.name: Content-length
content_length.description: Specifies the size of the binary file in bytes.

content_type_0c9fd2d.name: Content-type
content_type_0c9fd2d.description: Specifies the [media type](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics%5Fof%5FHTTP/MIME%5Ftypes) of the binary data.

depth.name: depth
depth.description:
Determines the level of nesting for content items that the API returns. By default, only the first level of linked items is returned, which is the same as setting {~depth=1~}. If you want to include more than one level of linked items in response, set the {~depth~} query parameter to {~2~} or more. If you need to exclude all linked items from the response, set the parameter to {~0~}.
Components are always present in response. See Linked content and components for more details.

elements.name: elements
elements.description:
Determines the elements to retrieve using a comma-separated list of element codenames. The {~elements~} query parameter applies to all content items within the response.

If not specified, all elements are retrieved. For more details, see [Projection](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/c4552a2f-142c-4415-b7aa-f2c5b165a84e).

example.Error: Invalid json. Content item codename: 'array_of_strings'. Content item name: 'Array of strings'

file_name.name: file_name
file_name.description:
Specifies the name of the uploaded binary file. The file name specified in the URL will be used for the asset name when you create an asset.

If the name of your file contains [reserved characters](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986#section-2.2), you need to URL encode the file name first. For instance, use `my%20file%232.png` instead of `my file#2.png`. The file will then show as `my file#2.png` in the Kontent.ai UI.

includetotalcount.name: includeTotalCount
includetotalcount.description:
Adds the information about the total number of content items matching your query. Only [the content filtering parameters](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/b6cf1d73-471a-4f1e-b0a9-f0e041e2d905) affect the resulting number. Other parameters in your query, such as `limit,` `skip`, or `order`, don't have an effect on it.

The number doesn't include linked items returned as part of the `modular_content` property. For the total number of items returned within the response, see the `X-Request-Charge` header.

When set to `true`, the pagination object returned in the API response contains an additional `total_count` property.

item_identifier.name: item_identifier
item_identifier.description: Identifies a content item by its internal ID (e.g., `335d17ac-b6ba-4c6a-ae31-23c1193215cb`), external ID (e.g., `external-id/custom-identifier-for-my-article`), or codename (e.g., `codename/my_article`).

language.name: language
language.description:
Determines which language variant of content items to return. By default, the API returns content in the default language.
If the requested content is not available in the specified language variant, the API follows the language fallbacks as configured in the Localization settings of your project.

language_identifier_for_variants.name: language_identifier
language_identifier_for_variants.description: Identifies the language by its internal ID (e.g., `d1f95fde-af02-b3b5-bd9e-f232311ccab8`) or codename (e.g., `codename/es-ES`).

limit_8cd54e2.name: limit
limit_8cd54e2.description:
Sets the number of objects to retrieve in a single request. If the `limit` parameter is not specified, the API returns all requested objects by default.

If `limit` is lower than the total number of objects matching your query, the `next_page` property in the `pagination` object of the API response will contain a URL to the next page of results.

The `limit` parameter affects only the number of items in the `items` property. It doesn't reduce the number of linked items in the `modular_content` property so you may hit the [response size limit](#section/Response-size) unexpectedly. You can set `depth=0` to avoid that.

order.name: order
order.description:
Determines the order of the retrieved objects. By default, the objects are sorted alphabetically by their codenames from A to Z in descending order.

To sort the requested objects in ascending order, set the `order` to `<property_name>[asc]` where `<property_name>` is the name of the object property you want to sort by. For example, `order=elements.title[asc]` or `order=system.codename[asc]`. Similarly, to sort in descending order, use the `[desc]` modifier. You can sort by any properties in the API response.

**Examples**

* Sort by date – `order=system.last_modified[desc]`
* Sort by a content item name – `order=system.name[asc]`
* Sort by an element value – `order=elements.<element_codename>[asc]`

project_id.name: project_id
project_id.description:
Identifies your project.

If you're using [environments](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/a814879f-64a2-4689-8a99-e4e98cdf60ba), the project ID becomes environment ID and specifies one of the project's environments.

skip.name: skip
skip.description:
Sets the number of objects to skip when requesting a list of objects. The `skip` parameter must be combined with the `limit` parameter to work. If `skip` is not specified, the API returns the first page of results.

You can combine the `limit` and `skip` parameters to specify page size and page number. For example, using `limit=10&skip=10` sets the page size to 10 and gets the second page of results.

type_identifier.name: type_identifier
type_identifier.description: Identifies the content type by internal ID (e.g., `269202ad-1d9d-47fd-b3e8-bdb05b3e3cf0`), external ID (e.g., `external-id/Content-Type-123`), or codename (e.g., `codename/hosted_video`).

workflow_identifier.name: workflow_identifier
workflow_identifier.description: Identifies the workflow by its internal ID (e.g., `8bfdb62d-7aa1-473b-9d80-311ef93db108`) or codename (e.g., `codename/my-workflow`).

workflow_step_identifier.name: workflow_step_identifier
workflow_step_identifier.description: Identifies the workflow step by its internal ID (e.g., `13145328-b946-4e47-9c9d-6f40c7aaeaef`) or codename (e.g., `codename/draft`).

x_kc_wait_for_loading_new_content.name: X-KC-Wait-For-Loading-New-Content
x_kc_wait_for_loading_new_content.description:
Determines whether the API waits while fetching content, if the requested content has changed since the last request. This is useful when retrieving changed content in reaction to a [webhook](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/5b87f0a1-c271-449d-a9dc-04f995c89589) call.

By default, when the header is not set, the API serves stale content (if cached by the CDN) while it's fetching the new content to minimize wait time. To always fetch new content, set the header value to {~true~}.

BearerAuthentication.description:
The Test API uses the `Authorization` header with a [bearer token](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6750) (API key) to authorize requests. To get your API key, go to [Kontent.ai](https://app.kontent.ai/) > Project settings > API keys. Requests with an incorrect or missing `Authorization` header will fail with an [error](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/62b06ae7-bac5-4d37-be97-efa30f879dd1).

To work with the Test API, send your requests over HTTPS and authenticate using the `Authorization` header in the following format: `Authorization: Bearer <YOUR_API_KEY>`.

You can authenticate your API requests using either the Management API key or Subscription API key:

* Management API key, accepted by all project-specific endpoints (all endpoints except from [Subscription](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/3380fb20-d3f3-4f03-a09a-f0b495a38785)).  
   * Limited to users with the Manage APIs permission.  
   * Provides access to a single Kontent.ai project. You will need a different Management API key for each of your projects.  
   * Can be used with Management API endpoints that get or modify objects in a single project.
* Subscription API key, accepted by all endpoints.  
   * Limited to subscription admins.  
   * Provides access to the projects and subscriptions the admin has access to.  
   * Can be used with all Management API endpoints.
